meanings.definition: The practice of engaging in maritime warfare under a commission of war
meanings.sent1: Privateering was a common practice during times of war.
meanings.sent2: The privateering ship set sail to intercept enemy vessels.
meanings.sent3: The privateering crew joked about being 'official pirates'.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of battle, privateering was their legal weapon.
meanings.sent5: The history books vividly describe the daring privateering missions.

meanings.definition: A privately owned vessel commissioned to attack enemy ships
meanings.sent1: The privateering ship was well-equipped for naval combat.
meanings.sent2: Privateering vessels were often faster than military ships.
meanings.sent3: The privateering captain proudly displayed his ship's flag.
meanings.sent4: The privateering ship sliced through the waves like a predator.
meanings.sent5: The privateering vessel's cannons roared in battle.

meanings.definition: The act of engaging in piracy for profit
meanings.sent1: Some sailors turned to privateering to earn quick money.
meanings.sent2: Privateering was a risky but lucrative business.
meanings.sent3: The privateering crew divided their spoils after a successful raid.
meanings.sent4: In the world of trade, privateering was a shadowy enterprise.
meanings.sent5: The allure of privateering tempted many to the dark side of the sea.
